result.execSummary:
The defendant Cherl Ann Geslin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Filed by L. Multhaulf. Re: status of Def. Reviewed by SRN. km
Diversion Agreement. Signed by all parties. km
Review on August 10, 2017 at 07:45 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly with student intern Tim Filipa. DF: Cherl Ann Geslin appeared. Case called at 10:34. There is an agreement to a one year deferred judgment of conviction. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Court informs DE on her rights to an atty. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives an atty today. DE pleads G to 16CM77. DE sworn. Crt reviews informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 16CM77. Court dismisses the domestic enhancer. Court does not enter the judgment of conviction today. Court signs the DJOC.  Review scheduled for August 10, 2017 at 07:45 am.
Filed by ADA Kelly. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF:  Cherl Ann Geslin appeared. Case called at 3:48. ADA Kelly updates the court, there is no resolution at this time. Court informs DE of her right to an Atty. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives her right to an Atty. Court informs DE of the difference of a jury trial vs. a court trial. DE freely voluntarily waives a jury trial. ADA Kelly informs the court that the student intern T. Filipa may be conducting the Court Trial.
Final pre-trial on August 1, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Final pre-trial on July 28, 2016 at 04:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 11, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung. Cherl Ann Geslin pro se. Case called at 1:04. ADA Hartung updates the court, there is no agreement today. Court informs the DE of her right to an Atty. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives her right to an Atty. Court sets the court for trial. Cut off for negotiations will be 07-28-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 04:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung Cherl Ann Geslin appears by phone pro se. Case called at 4:27. ADA Hartung updates the court. There is an agreement for a diversion and requests a plea hearing date. Court informs DE to her right to an atty. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Filed by Def. Requesting a continuance of 5/23/2016 FPT. km
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung Cherl Ann Geslin pro se. Case called at 10:32. Court reviews file. Court reviews DE rights to an atty. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights to an atty. ADA Hartung will extend a written offer with directions on how the DE should proceed from there. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jason B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: Proctor for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Sharon Correll,  Cherl Ann Geslin pro se. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
